text.head: Fort Walton Beach
text.p: Fort Walton Beach is a small city in Emerald Coast region of Florida, forty miles east of Pensacola.
text.head: By plane

list.item: Destin–Fort Walton Beach Airport ( VPS ). Serves Fort Walton Beach and nearby Valparaiso. American Eagle, Delta Air Lines, Delta Connection, United Express serve the airport.

text.head: By car
text.p: US 98 connects Fort Walton Beach with Pensacola and Panama City. It also connects with nearby Destin. Florida 85 connects the area with I-10.
text.head: Get around
text.p: Fort Walton Beach has two main arterials. The Miracle Strip Parkway (US 98) travels along the seacoast and through Eglin Air Force Base, and the Eglin Parkway (Florida SR 85) links the city with Okaloosa Regional Airport.

text.head: Do

list.item: Visit the beach.
Billy Bowlegs Festival, pirate themed street party early each June.

text.head: Buy

list.item: Antique stores and shops along Highway 98 / Miracle Strip Parkway across from the Indian Temple Mound.

text.head: Eat
text.p: Ft. Walton Beach has many restaurants, including:

list.item: Anglers by the base of the pier on Okaloosa Island
The Breakfast Club.
Fish Lipz, 203 Brooks St (off Highway 98 by the bridge to Okaloosa Island), ☏ +1 850 226-7123 . Waterfront views, good food and drink. Often have small live bands in the evenings.
Fudpuckers.
Manhattan Pizza.
Taj Mahal, 217 Miracle Strip Parkway, ☏ +1 850 243-1648 . Southwest. Indian food. The tasty food and entertaining belly-dancer compensate for rather indifferent and amateurish wait staff.

text.head: Go next

list.item: Destin is just to the east on the other side of Okaloosa Island.
Pensacola is about half an hour to the west.
